subject: Re: [junit] Unknown Source?
msgSnippet: You may use compiler with no-debug-info settings . Some compilers exclude debug info (VisualAge for example). When using javac and other command line tools
messageBody:
You may use compiler with "no-debug-info" settings . Some compilers exclude
debug info (VisualAge for example). When using javac and other command line
tools ensure that all debug info is included and not excluded with special
option. For javac use -g option.

Hope it helps

Alexander
----- Original Message -----
From: "Guerry Semones" <gsemones@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 04, 2002 11:39 PM
Subject: [junit] Unknown Source?


> I've used Junit in past jobs, and do not recall seeing this issue. I am
> running Junit under JDK1.31 on Windows and a Unix platform. In either
> case, when I get a failure's stack trace, I get "unknown source" for my
> java code, rather than a line number where one would expect it.
>
> I didn't catch this in the FAQ. Any ideas what I'm doing wrong?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Guerry
